column1: Microsoft’s Tuesday patch-fest may have reacted quite negatively with Windows Server 2008 R2 running VMware
column2: leaving servers offline and administrators scrambling to recover IP addresses.

column1: Twitter user @Sikorsky78 noted the problem just after the patches hit:It seems that the latest MS patches ate my vmxnet3 adapters on Windows 2008R2 :(.
Microsoft has remained tightlipped on the issue
column2: leaving it to users to work out what part of the update borked their carefully crafted networks.

column1: The issue appears isolated to Windows Server 2008 R2 installations
column2: with those running VMware VMs particularly hard hit.
probably best to think very carefully before allowing these patches anywhere near a production environment
